credit_line: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund and through gift of Mrs. Edward Stern
dimensions: 18 x 18 cm (7 1/16 x 7 1/16 in.) fringed on all sides
title: Flora's Retinue: Poppy
medium:
Medium: linen warp, silk weft
Technique: 4&1 satin damask
description: Small square doily, fringed on all sides, with an ivory linen warp and an olive ground. A figure of a woman dressed as a poppy with and sitting on the stem of a large poppy, with the word POPPY in the upper left corner, all appearing in ivory on an olive ground. A set of six, the doilies would have been used on the table as part of a dessert service.
name: Doily
